attributes.action: Change of employment law for terminal/long term cancer carers
attributes.background: My husband is diagnosed with terminal cancer. I work full time (need to) and the only options available to me to care for him during treatment and for longer term care are 3 days compassionate leave, unpaid leave or annual leave.
attributes.additional_details: It seems wrong that someone can have maternity leave paid but when your partner is dying you are entitled to next to nothing. Given the number of people who have to work full time in order to keep the family home running during these very difficult times, employment law does not reflect this.  If we are a truly 'caring' nation then it is time this is addressed.

attributes.action: Pause HMRC's office closures until the taxation impact of Brexit is understood
attributes.background:
Leaving the EU will have a major impact on the work done by HMRC; particularly VAT, Customs and International Trade. 
We call on HMRC to suspend its plans to close offices and cut jobs, until Parliament agrees the functions HMRC will need to undertake following the decision to leave the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) plans to close 90% of its offices; and cut 9,000 more jobs by 2021
HMRC refuse to acknowledge the organisational impact of leaving the EU, saying it doesn’t change their closure plans. This threatens HMRC's future ability to collect the taxes which provide for the funding for essential services including defence, education, healthcare, policing and welfare
HMRC has already closed its office in Newry, which stands on what will be the UK's only land border with the EU

attributes.action: Lower the legal age of smear tests from 25 to 16
attributes.background: I have seen so many cervical cancer stories from people under the age of 25 and this has resulted in a tragedy. Smear tests would detect any problems related to this and action could be taken, but since the legal age is 25 this cannot be implimented.
attributes.additional_details:
Read further stories at...
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-2868392/Heartbreak-young-woman-died-cervical-cancer-23-refused-smear-test-managed-buy-family-Christmas-presents-passed-away.htmlway.html
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-3207991/Mother-24-dies-cervical-cancer-turned-smear-test-young.html
 https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/cancer-chat/thread/im-23-and-denied-a-smear-test

attributes.action: Give all members of the British Armed forces a pay rise equal to politicians.
attributes.background: The people who defend our countries interests are under valued and the job they do is undermined by such a pitiful 1% pay rise. When the government get 11%

attributes.action: Bring back legal aid for family law. And give farthers 50/50 rights
attributes.background: it's diabolical that legal aid has been removed from family law. Dad's all over the country are not getting a fare hearing and through lack of knowledge and unfare rules that favor the mother we are loosing are kids. the law needs to be changed to stop mothers alienating fathers from there own blood
attributes.additional_details: My son saw a picture that was on my Facebook page and it stated dad's are just as important as mums.  I was shocked at my 7 year old sons response he looked at it laughed and said with no hesitation no theye are not and walked away. I was so upset at this because one day my boys will be dad's to. And they will start life having a very  low estimate of them self's as farthers.  And I think it's time for dad's to make a stand for our children...

attributes.action: Give chimmy a visitors visa so she can visit her mum before she dies.
attributes.background:
My auntie Vera was on BBC news this
Evening because she is currently at pilgrims hospice dying of cancer. Our government is currently refusing a dying woman her last request. Vera's daughter chimmy has been refused a visiting visa just to come and see her mum before she dies.
attributes.additional_details: Our government has continued to take in thousands of immigrants but won't let my auntie who has worked for the NHS for years, paid her taxes and contributed to our community have her last wish. Please sign to try and make her last wish come true ❤️

attributes.action: Make it easier for younger women to get sterilisation in the UK.
attributes.background: Women are encouraged to wait until they are around 30 before the NHS considers they are sure they want to be child free, in the mean time facing potential problems with various contraception methods and unplanned pregnancy. Please can women be taken more seriously with their child free  choice?

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for glucose levels of newborns to be checked before discharge
attributes.background: The test is a simple heel prick.  It can help to indicate if your baby is  converting its milk feed into the required source of glucose. If the level is too low the body/brain cannot function sufficiently,  the baby may have seizures and fall into a coma. Stop it happening to someone else's baby.
attributes.additional_details: My daughters levels were not checked.  We were discharged and she subsequently fell into a coma and had seizures.  This has left her with damage to her brain and epilepsy. A simple test prior to leaving hospital would have shown low blood sugars and immediate attention could have prevented the ensuing damage.  I wish to prevent this happening to anyone else.

attributes.action: Demand a second Scottish referendum if the UK votes to leave the EU
attributes.background: If the majority of Scottish voters vote to remain part of the EU but the UK as a whole votes to leave on 23rd June 2016, Scotland, as a europhile country, should have another referendum on independence.

attributes.action: To educate parents of the dangers- arrangement of furniture in child's bedroom.
attributes.background: Noah had somehow managed to climb out of his cot and onto the changing table beside it. It is unknown what exactly happened on that fateful morning, but Noah had slipped between the two pieces of furniture and become trapped, causing him to become asphyxiated and sadly die. He was found hanging.
attributes.additional_details:
As Noah's mother, I feel this subject should reach new parents when they attend antenatal and midwife appointments. 
There is so much information out there relating to other risks such as SIDS and bath safety etc, however there seem to be more incidents regarding bedroom furniture and cots as I research further, but not much is being done to make changes or raise awareness.

attributes.action: Future DWP (Atos) assessments should be carried out by Healthcare Professionals
attributes.background: The current system where a DWP official completes a one-fits-all form for Personal Independent Payments (PIP) and Employment Support Allowance (ESA) is not fit for purpose. This health related assessment should be carried out by Healthcare Professionals that know you and/or know about your illness.

attributes.action: Keep the right to have elected parent governors on every school's governing body
attributes.background: By law, parent governors currently have reserved seats on a school governing body, allowing parents to engage with management. Without them, Academies will not be answerable to the community for their actions. If your village school sells it's playing field or has poor results you will have no say.
attributes.additional_details:
The Education white paper published March 17th, 2016 states: “We will expect all governing boards to focus on seeking people with the right skills for governance, and so we will no longer require academy trusts to reserve places for elected parents on governing boards.
“We will offer this freedom to all open academies, and as we move towards a system where every school is an academy, fully skills-based governance will become the normal across the education system.”

attributes.action: Establish that a child has a default right to equal contact with both parents.
attributes.background: Where there is no evidence to suggest that a child should be subject to a protection enquiry in accordance with s47 (1) of the Children Act 1989, the law should detail and confirm that every child has an automatic right to 50/50 contact with both their mother and father.
attributes.additional_details:
Right now there are people deliberately denying their ex-partners from having contact with their children, simply to be vindictive, or to be manipulative, or in order to establish a 'status quo'.
Court orders take too long to acquire; and without them, a Non Resident Parent is powerless. 
This petition asks that the government prevents harm, by determining that every child, who is not at risk, has the automatic right to equal contact with both parents at the point of a relationship breakdown.

attributes.action: Assign ADHD/ADD units to primary schools
attributes.background: Children with ADHD/ADD are unable to concentrate in a highly stimulating environment and are suffering academically. Some are even considered a nuisance in the class room and quite commonly called disruptive.  Having their own space with specialist teachers will give them the help they deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
All children have the right to education. In my personal experience and in my job role i have encountered many children with ADHD/ADD that have struggled their whole school life. They go on to secondary and end up being expelled. Their need is high, but is displaced as disruptive or a nuisance.
Schools are yet to accommodate these children.  These children struggle in crowds and then are expected to sit in a classroom of thirty children and focus. They are being let down by the education system

attributes.action: Legalise the production, use and sale of cannabis in the uk.
attributes.background: The use, production and sale of cannabis would create jobs boost the economy and has been proven to treat diseases and lower pain it would also allow the prison system to focus on real crimes.

attributes.action: Introduce a wildlife conservation points system for all new builds.
attributes.background: Every new build, whether new homes or new commercial builds would have to gain a certain level of points before the building is signed off. I.e 2 points for a hedgehog hole, 2 points for a bird box, points for native planting etc. Points could be doubled if used in the correct scenario.
attributes.additional_details: This would massively help to reduce the decline in many species highlighted by the 'State of Nature report published 3 years ago which reported that 60% of uk species were in decline. This would make a big difference in helping species that now rely on the urban environment such as the hedgehog, swift and house martin to name a few. The cost of the build would be far outweighed by the benefits to wildlife and humans.

attributes.action: Abolish the "Civil" football ban
attributes.background: How can you ban lads from going to football and take away their passports when they haven't even commited any crime

attributes.action: Introduce a national strategy to reduce excess winter deaths
attributes.background: Every winter, thousands of people die in the UK due to the cold.  In 2014/2015 the number of excess winter deaths rose to 43,900 according to the Office of National Statistics.
attributes.additional_details:
Although there is a clear link between excess winter deaths and the cold, the UK suffers from higher levels of excess winter deaths than a number of traditionally colder countries including Scandinavian countries such as Sweden and Finland.

Currently, the government does not have a national plan to reduce the number of excess winter deaths. 

This petition is calling on the government to take action and introduce a national strategy to reduce excess winter deaths.

attributes.action: Implement the Tipping Point declaration as a legal requirement in the UK:
attributes.background: We want every UK hospitality business* to be legally required to complete the Tipping Point Campaign declaration. It must also be made compulsory for a printed copy of the completed declaration to be displayed at each premises and made available on company websites.
attributes.additional_details:
This simple solution offers the transparency long called for by hospitality customers and employees alike so they can make an informed decision as to how they wish to engage with the business.

The proposed Tipping Point Campaign declaration questionnaire: 
www.tippingpointcampaign.org.uk/the-declaration/

*a business whose primary activity is the provision of food, drink and/or hospitality

attributes.action: Spend ALL Surplus National Insurance Payments On The NHS
attributes.background:
Chancellor George Osborne is currently sitting on a £30 BILLION National Insurance surplus. Unable to spend it on anything else and unwilling to spend it on the NHS, he has chosen to let it gather dust while our NHS is desperate need of extra funding. 
.
attributes.additional_details:
National ­Insurance money can only be used for the NHS or benefits. So since he can’t spend it on anything else and chooses not to fund ­hospitals, the Chancellor lets it sit there.

We need a lasting solution to fund a service we all depend on. So let’s fill the black hole and fund a new National Health and Care Service with our own little pot of NHS gold.

It is clear that the Tory government is trying to privatise the NHS through under funding until we have no choice but to privatise.

attributes.action: Put all primary and senior school teachers on the Shortage Occupation List.
attributes.background: The Home Office has enacted a new settlement threshold for Tier 2 skilled workers, which includes teachers. The Home Office Impact Assessment estimates this will result in the forced departure of 36% of migrant primary school teachers and 9% of migrant senior school teachers as their visas expire.
attributes.additional_details:
The Home Office must commission the Migration Advisory Committee to study the teacher recruitment crisis. The HO will need to act on the MAC's recommendation.

Chemistry, physics and maths teachers are already on the SOL but every subject faces staff shortages. Teaching cannot afford to lose essential staff purely because they are underpaid.

42% of migrant nurses would have been forced to leave until nurses were put on the SOL.

Learn more about the impacts of the £35k threshold at stop35k.org

attributes.action: Demand Regulation for Extreme Sports #ExtremeSafety
attributes.background:
Extreme sports are not fair ground attractions. Let’s get our MPs working with other EU member states to recognize this life-threatening activity requires serious regulation.

Sign and share this petition today. Tweet #ExtremeSafety to save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-33618917

http://change4kleyo.org/

attributes.action: Retractions of misleading media should be the same prominence as the original
attributes.background:
Highlighted by the Sun's front page article on Muslims support for Jihadi fighters. A retraction was ordered as the survey used was deliberately misleading, it was 'hidden' in a boring column of text titled 'Ispo ruling upheld'

Retractions should be equal prominence to original.
attributes.additional_details:
People have a right to know when they have been mislead, and clearly the majority who read the headline article will not have read the retraction.

Deliberately obscure retraction: https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CedPBYBWQAAtDs1.jpg

Original headline: https://vice-images.vice.com/images/articles/meta/2015/11/24/i-conducted-the-muslim-poll-the-sun-jihadi-sympathy-1448380391.png

attributes.action: Amnesty for commonwealth illegal skilled immigrants.
attributes.background: In the time of labour government a huge numbers of students came from commonwealth countries but for the immigration cuts like psw tier 1, most of them left United Kingdom. A very few number of them are still surviving in uk in a miserable life, who can do work for the nation for batter future.
attributes.additional_details: The former honorable immigration minister and present prime minister knows everything clearly how they made the condition. So, please take an argent action.

attributes.action: Do not grant funding for a replacement of Trident
attributes.background: Trident is a set of submarines armed with nuclear missiles. They are considered to be "deterrents". The cost for these WMDs have been in the tens of billions. It is now on the table to replace the Trident programme, with something even more expensive. The "cheap" proposal is at 167 billion pounds.
attributes.additional_details:
"The overall cost of replacing and maintaining Britain's nuclear deterrent will reach 167 billion pounds ($256 billion), much more than expected, according to a lawmaker's and Reuters' calculations based on official figures." — http://reut.rs/1UybhEG

It is money that "would be enough to fully fund A&E services for 40 years, employ 150,000 new nurses, build 1.5 million affordable homes, build 30,000 new primary schools, or cover tuition fees for 4 million students." — http://bit.ly/1oY82dU

attributes.action: Teens and young adults with Type 1 Diabetes have a right to PIP.
attributes.background: Type 1 diabetes is a life long, life threatening condition. Current government legislation does consider it to be a disability for children aged 16 and above.  PIP would give them the financial help they need to fund the additional things they need to become independent.
attributes.additional_details: It is a proven fact that without the help and support of parents/health professionals and peers.  Adolescents would struggle to cope with the day to day care of dealing with the challenges of Type 1 diabetes.  They are more likely to be hospitalised and suffer damage to their bodies that come with poor management.  The policies of this current government, denies them the support they need during these difficult years. PIP awards would help these young people cope with the financial strain of daily living, and give recognition that Type 1 diabetes is a disability.

attributes.action: Parliament to modify a rule* that stops the NHS from saving money on a drug.
attributes.background:
This is a unique situation.  One Swiss pharmaceutical company makes 2 very similar medicines: ranibizumab, known by its trade name Lucentis, and bevacizumab ( Avastin).  However Lucentis is 80 times more expensive than Avastin.
Research has shown that both drugs can prevent blindness equally.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS patients with age-related macular degeneration took part in the IVAN study in 2008.

The MHRA's Guidance Note 14 specifically prohibits* obtaining a licensed special medicine in order to save money. 

The appropriateness of this sanction when applied to the unique circumstance of Lucentis & Avastin merits parliamentary debate to change this law.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/373505/The_supply_of_unlicensed_medicinal_products__specials_.pdf

attributes.action: Please lift the ban on Flights from UK to Sharm-Sheikh-Airport.
attributes.background: Since the downing of a Russian passenger plane on 31st October 2015. Security at the airport is better than it has ever been at this time and Sharm itself is deemed to be safe. The problem was the airport security and I believe Egypt has rectified those problems.

attributes.action: Provide accessible mental health services for 18-30 year olds
attributes.background: Adult mental health services tend to cater for the middle-aged and the elderly in our society, not for the young adults who have just come out of CAMHS. Young adults who enter the services are faced with the battle to be properly supported, as the services are not suited to their specific needs.
attributes.additional_details:
As a result of not having a specialist young adults' service, young adults have been left to fend for themselves in a system that doesn't understand them; fighting to be recognised in hospitals which want to care for the middle-aged and elderly; less able to care for themselves due to a lack of proper support; and less likely to seek help with their mental health in the first place.

We ask you to consider putting some of the limited mental health funding towards a service for 18-30 year olds.

attributes.action: Devolve Air Passenger Duty (APD) to Wales
attributes.background:
Introduced in 2009 the is widely agreed to be damaging to the economy in particular tourism. From April 1st 2016 it will add up to £142 to the cost of flying from the UK.

Air Passenger Duty has been devolved to Northern Ireland & Scotland therefore it is only fair it is also devolved to Wales.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2014 - Silk Commission recommended that Air Passenger Duty be devolved to Wales.

Devolving Air Passenger Duty to Wales and aboloshing it would boost tourism, boost the Welsh economy, reduce air fares from Wales and also increase the number of destinations available from Cardiff Airport.

attributes.action: Set up housing for veterans before they leave the armed forces.
attributes.background: Each year many veterans come out of the armed forces homeless. This means that veterans are living on the streets. In 2013 it was calculated that 9,000 ex-service personnel were found homeless. Ex-service personnel are becoming homeless and it is on the rise.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/9000-ex-service-personnel-homeless-after-2071049

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-13983279 

These are links of news articles of ex-service personnel being homeless.

attributes.action: Gastrointestinal Motility disorders in patients with Ehlers Danlos Syndrome
attributes.background:
There is a huge gap in healthcare for conditions such as gastropareses, pseudo obstruction, dysmotility , intestinal failure etc
These conditions result in severe pain, bloating, vomiting, malnutrition and inability to eat to name a few.
This severly impacts lives, & quality of life is very low.
attributes.additional_details:
Although there is no cure there is lack of understanding by healthcare providers to the point we either have to tell them what to do ourselves or get sent home with little to no treatment plan, we get passed from doctor to doctor who each give up on us, many dont even get to the stage of diagnosis. 
I am asking for a nation wide campaign to educate GPS , Consultants, Nurses and health workers in general on the importance of management and understanding of these conditions. 
We should not be left to suffer with no one to listen, help or control the symptoms.

attributes.action: Don't invest in the Hinkley reactor. Subsidise green energy and storage instead
attributes.background:
Hinkley is predicted to cost £18bn to build, and it will cost consumers upwards of £30bn to run.
It will displace billions of investment that could otherwise be spent on green energy. 

Energy demands and generation methods change every year, we should not make such a costly long term commitment
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/apr/05/scrapping-hinkley-for-renewable-alternatives-will-save-tens-of-billions

http://about.bnef.com/landing-pages/five-reasons-build-hinkley/

attributes.action: Repeal the Housing & Planning Act passed in May 2016.
attributes.background: In times of increasing job insecurity & homelessness, instead of building much-needed council & social housing to create homes and jobs, this Act forces the sale of council homes, prohibits the building of new council homes, allows councils to sell off council estates and ends security of tenure.
attributes.additional_details:
It also forces existing council tenants earning above a certain amount to pay rent at inflated, unregulated market prices and extends the right to buy to Housing Association tenants, thereby greatly reducing the country's stock of homes to let at a reasonable rent.
This Act will exacerbate the hardships suffered by the most vulnerable who will be forced into costly and unstable private rented accommodation and will place many more in a vulnerable, insecure situation for the first time.

attributes.action: Permanent 'dogs die in hot cars' signs to be in all public car parks.
attributes.background: Despite constant public messages and awareness raising people continue to leave their dogs locked in hot cars. This is unacceptable and many dogs suffer. The law is also very unclear on what direct action members of the public can take. A dog can die in the time it takes for police to attend.
attributes.additional_details: Permanent signs in all public car parks, give traffic wardens the power to break car window in an emergency and clear up and improve rights of the general public to intervene if necessary.

attributes.action: Hold public consultation on NHS Sustainability and Transformation Footprints
attributes.background: By June 2016, forty four geographical areas in England are to produce a five year NHS Sustainability and Transformation plans showing that they would balance their budget by eliminating all deficits in this financial year and implement new models of care as laid out in the Five Year Forward View.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that this would have a profound effect on the delivery of local health services. It should be noted that none of these plans are based on evidence or assessment of clinical needs. Furthermore the plans have not been discussed in the House of Commons and there has been no public consultation. We demand that the government should launch an urgent public consultation on this major reorganisation of the NHS.

attributes.action: Clarify to public the many contributions to education brought by EU membership
attributes.background: Contributions include opportunities for young people to study and work in other EU countries, for teachers to share effective practice, funded project opportunities through Lingua and Erasmus +, support for research enabling major projects to be undertaken, social and cultural links at all levels.
attributes.additional_details: The significant contributions to educational purposes that have been brought by EU membership extend across the curriculum and beyond the education system. The Language Alliance supports this petition; we are a broad-based independent Forum, created in 2002, aiming to bring to the attention of a wider public the importance of language to the development of community understanding and empowerment on a local, national or international level; members attend on a personal basis.

attributes.action: Stop treating Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME) as chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS)
attributes.background: The NHS offers treatment for chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) and tells us that CFS is "also known as" Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME) in order to justify treating ME the same as CFS. It is unethical to treat one condition as another; it makes patients more ill and is a waste of time and money.
attributes.additional_details: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis means "muscle pain + inflammation of the brain and spinal cord", in other words it is a neurological illness. It is accepted as such by the World Health Organization (WHO). The term CFS was coined in the USA and seized upon by psychiatrists in the UK, and today the psychiatric view of ME (that ME does not exist but is really a "fatigue syndrome") now dictates the Department of Health, Nice, and NHS policy. While this policy remains in place, ME patients are untreated.

attributes.action: The removal of umbrella companies as payment option
attributes.background: We work on zero hour contracts which is fine because we are contractors but therefore we shouldn't be stung by payment companies charging us n.I contributions for both us and our employers

attributes.action: Introduce the Varicella Zoster (Chickenpox) into the UK Childhood Immunisations.
attributes.background: Chickenpox is pretty much unheard of in the USA, Japan and Germany. A vaccination was approved in 1995 and has been used for 20 years. It  was combined with the MMR vaccine creating an MMRV vaccine in 2005. The World Health Organisation includes it as one of children's vital immunisations.
attributes.additional_details:
Chickenpox complications include severe skin infections, scars, brain damage and death. There is no reason children should suffer these complications when there is a safe vaccine already available. 
Studies have confirmed that the cost to the NHS would be offset by not having to deal with chickenpox complications, antibiotics prescribed, hospital, GP appointments aswell as time taken off work by parents caring for children infected with Chickenpox.

attributes.action: Cruelty over Chinese dog meat festival should be raised with the Chinese gov
attributes.background: Chinese population has eaten dog meat for the last 400 years. A festival is held annually in Yulin, Guangxi, China during the Summer solstice in June. About 10,000 to 15,000 dogs are consumed over a 10 day period.
attributes.additional_details:
The dogs are often not killed humanely. Dogs are often beaten to death as the Chinese like adrenaline soaked meat. 

Since the local government denies any official involvement or endorsement of the festival then this should be something that can be raised quite easily with the Chinese government. 

I accept the Chinese right to eat Dog as we eat Cow, Sheep etc. My objection is that the dogs are frightened an abused before inhumainly killed. Please can you debate I feel that there is little I can do, so looking for my government to help.

attributes.action: Review the limitations for Red Arrows air displays this year in particular FIA.
attributes.background: The new CAA regulations regarding air show displays have led to a review of the Red Arrow displays this year most importantly at the Farnborough International Airshow. The Red Arrows have always been an important part of the FIA, and safety has always been upmost in their display.

attributes.action: Don't tax Adult Colouring Books as they are a therapy
attributes.background: So I am an avid colouring therapy addict, just like thousands of people across the world and now the British government are trying to tax our therapy. We do this to escape from a lot of things in life for many it is the only luxury they have. Please don't tax our colour therapy

attributes.action: Cats not in an approved breeding programme should be microchipped and neutered.
attributes.background: Female cats can become pregnant at 4 months and give birth at 6 months.  This is not good for anyone involved. A legal requirement for neutering, plus compulsory microchipping to enable cat owners to be identified, would prevent this happening, and also take the pressure off cat rescue centres.
attributes.additional_details: At my local rescue centre alone, there are presently around 40 kittens, and things will most likely get worse as the summer progresses.  It happens every year, and the situation is repeated in rescue centres up and down the country, mainly due to owner ignorance and/or lack of responsibility.  Compulsory microchipping and neutering of cats would go some way towards preventing this, and would result in happier, healthier cats.

attributes.action: The Government should publish its plans should the Country vote to leave the EU.
attributes.background: Having offered the voters the choice of remaining or leaving the EU they should tell the voters what they would do in the event of either result. This would better inform the voter, reduce uncertainty and reduce some of the economic damage till the vote and demonstrate they have thought it through.

attributes.action: Make sure all disabled people can have the adaptations they need
attributes.background:
Disabled Facilities Grants adapt people’s homes to be safe and suitable.

Current funding is not enough to provide everyone with the adaptations they need. 

We petition you to calculate the annual need for DFG funding at a local authority level, and ensure that this funding need is met.
attributes.additional_details:
A 2011 report by the BRE stated: “the total amount required… is £1.9bn.”

The total funding over the last 5 years was £1 billion - only half of what’s needed.

Though funding will rise by 2019/20, there is no assurance that it will meet the need.

Isle of Wight Council have found that every £1 invested in DFGs could return £7.30 a year in social care savings.

In the past 5 years, the government may have missed savings of more than £47 billion in social care costs.

This needs to change.

Thank you.

attributes.action: Stop the CCG from cutting NHS funded IVF services in Suffolk.
attributes.background:
Keeping NHS funded IVF services will impact on so many people's lives by allowing them to have the family they've always wanted.
It would be so unfair to take away an opportunity for people to have a family when they cannot conceive themselves.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.hsj.co.uk/hsj-local/commissioners/nhs-ipswich-and-east-suffolk-ccg/more-south-east-ccgs-plan-cuts-to-ivf-services/7008343.fullarticle

attributes.action: Reopen The Security Industry Authority (SIA) Contact Centre
attributes.background: As of the 6th July, The SIA have closed their contact centre in favour of a online application process. Claiming their new self-service website has been designed to provide an easier, more convenient and efficient service but has not lived up to their high expectations.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.facebook.com/thesiauk/

Multiple issues with new self-service website can be seen in the comments of The SIA Facebook page. One of the biggest complaints being unable to receive a response to any issues or queries.

attributes.action: Condemn Guatemala for it's aggression and belligerence against Belize
attributes.background: Guatemala continues to show aggression towards Belize. Not respecting Territorial Borders of Belize by repeatedly encroaching into Belize Waters in the Sarstoon River. Arresting and confining Civilians in Belize waters and threatening Belize Military Forces in the Sarstoon area.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2007, Guatemala has repeatedly aggressed against Belize, refused to respect its borders and allowed it's citizens to pillage and steal Belizean forest products, create Milpas in Belize National Parks including the growing of Marijuana. They have threatened the Belize Defence Forces and crossed into Belize waters a number of time to prevent the legal passage of both Belizean civilians and the B D F. Failed in their duty to convict the murderer of Belize Policeman Danny Conorquie last year.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory voting and also a 'none of the above' box on ballot papers
attributes.background: With constant low turnouts for UK elections it always favours the establishment as they will always get their voters out which can be enough in areas who only have 30/40% turnout. We favour an Australian-style compulsory voting as long as they got a 'none of the above' box on the ballot paper.
